Risk factors for foot ulcers: OAHI, neuropathy with impaired statics/deformities of the foot, history of ulceration, social insecurity, etc.

Grading: 0: absence of sensory neuropathy and arteriopathy 1: presence of isolated sensory neuropathy 2: association of neuropathy with arteriopathy or foot/toe deformities 3: history of ulceration or amputation

question.title: What is the primary risk factor for foot ulcers in patients with diabetes?

option_a.title: Neuropathy with impaired statics/deformities of the foot
option_a.description: A common complication of diabetes that can lead to foot ulcers

option_b.title: Social insecurity
option_b.description: A social determinant that can increase the risk of foot ulcers in patients with diabetes

option_c.title: History of ulceration
option_c.description: A risk factor for foot ulcers, but not the primary one

option_d.title: Arteriopathy
option_d.description: A vascular complication that can increase the risk of foot ulcers
